column4: Netsplit kornbluth.freenode.net <-> irc.freenode.net quits: mcp, CarlFK,  allbert, GodTodd, ladynikon, cdavis, darrend, ak__, SimNIX, CaBa\,  (+64  more, use /NETSPLIT to show all of them)
oh ok. i didnt see a bunch disappear on #ubuntu-offtopic
not many are disappearing in my other channels either just here
how does irssi know when its a netsplit?
really? that seems odd.  how are they using 1/2 words?
the same way you can use short ints in 32bit
do they just put 0's in the empty bits?
this is all the job of the c library, and the instructions allow for using both sides of the word
addressing would be weird like that.  you'd have 2 pieces of data in the same address, wouldnt you?
heh im forgetting too.  that was beginning of the semester stuff, so i'm a little fuzzy
we never see the physical addresses anyway
